channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Getting Aid Into Gaza
item.description: We explain why it has been such a challenge.

item.title: As Ramaphosa Takes Oath, 4 Challenges for South Africa’s New Government
item.description: For the first time since the fall of apartheid, the nation must rely on a coalition of rival parties to govern. Can they get along enough to pull the country out of its crises?

item.title: Rich Gen Zers and millennials are investing in jewelry, sneakers and fine wine instead of traditional assets, says Bank of America
item.description: And they feel better than anyone else about the state of the economy.

item.title: Netanyahu Lashes Out at U.S., and the Stock Market’s New King
item.description: Plus, baseball legend Willie Mays dies at 93.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Debris From Destruction Adds to Dire Health Crisis in Gaza, U.N. Says
item.description: More than eight months of Israeli bombardment has left more than 39 million tons of debris, a preliminary assessment found.

item.title: OneUnited Bank CEO: Ending slavery is the best economic decision America ever made
item.description: The decision to end slavery ultimately had the profound impact of making America the strongest country in the world, writes OneUnited Bank CEO Kevin Cohee.

item.title: In North Macedonia, Disputes Over History Extend to Statues
item.description: North Macedonia has claimed historical figures as part of a drive to build a national identity. That has ruffled the feathers of the Balkan nation’s neighbors.

item.title: In North Macedonia, Disputes Over History Extend to Statues
item.description: North Macedonia has claimed historical figures as part of a drive to build a national identity. That has ruffled the feathers of the Balkan nation’s neighbors.

item.title: Prada bosses want to be more like Gen Z because ‘when you get older, you overthink and limit yourself’
item.description: The bosses at Prada disagree want to be more Gen Z. Why? Because 'youth is the future'.

item.title: Here Is Why Many Fear More Bloodshed in Darfur
item.description: Satellite and video evidence shows that thousands of homes have been razed and tens of thousands of people forced to flee a city in Sudan.

item.title: Here Is Why Many Fear More Bloodshed in Darfur
item.description: Satellite and video evidence shows that thousands of homes have been razed and tens of thousands of people forced to flee a city in Sudan.

item.title: Lowe's CEO went from earning $4.35 an hour at Target to being one of only 8 Black Fortune 500 CEOs with this strategy
item.description: “I had to find a way to differentiate myself,” Marvin Ellison said.

item.title: Supreme Court Ruling on Bump Stocks Could Open Door to More Lethal Weapons
item.description: The court’s decision has the potential to undercut President Biden’s efforts to restrict other gun accessories that enable semiautomatic rifles to fire at speeds rivaling those of machine guns.

item.title: A Massacre Threatens Darfur — Again
item.description: Darfur, the region of Sudan once synonymous with genocide, may be on the brink of a new chapter of horror.

item.title: The number of Black Fortune 500 CEOs is still abysmally low: could a DEI practice be to blame?
item.description: Corporations have touted their diversity initiatives, but may not be following through
